title: Actyx Release
body:
-------------------------
Overview:
  * actyx:		2.8.2 --> 2.9.0
  * cli:		2.3.0 --> 2.4.0
  * node-manager:		2.6.0 --> 2.7.0
-------------------------
Detailed changelog:
* actyx		2.9.0
    * New feature: support ax event restore [738209ef299f1927a0ae496ec61bd74ce068dc4b]
    * Bug fix: make DEBUG log level more useful for connectivity troubleshooting [c2708b838facf288545c699377dd30a8a0bfb368]
    * Bug fix: log result of first connection attempt to initial peers [c6e42839dfad644b6f882f78b4f366896926d94b]
    * Bug fix: log when initial peers are not accepted (e.g. due to being on localhost) [c6e42839dfad644b6f882f78b4f366896926d94b]
* cli		2.4.0
    * New feature: event dump and restore [738209ef299f1927a0ae496ec61bd74ce068dc4b]
    * New feature: add ability to add authorized key directly via filesystem [a2fa68000c66c342fcb48b26fbb9e66194f6a61b]
    * New feature: specify timeout for `nodes ls` [eff060d41848c18001031686b23d1b9904a714b1]
* node-manager		2.7.0
    * Bug fix: clearly distinguish between connected and disconnected peers [aeffceb7c7a58f2ebc75c90ef69de56a29495a62]
    * Bug fix: don't disconnect during node swarm-layer startup [aeffceb7c7a58f2ebc75c90ef69de56a29495a62]
    * Bug fix: fix incorrect swarm connectivity diagnostic [aeffceb7c7a58f2ebc75c90ef69de56a29495a62]
    * New feature: add ability to configure node connectivity timeout [aeffceb7c7a58f2ebc75c90ef69de56a29495a62]
    * New feature: highlight under which address a peer is connected to [aeffceb7c7a58f2ebc75c90ef69de56a29495a62]
-------------------------
Commit of release: 8640fb6712a255980b488cd337641d77a18022e3
Time of release: 2021-12-14 08:54:58 UTC

title: Adds diagnostic features and bug fixes to Node Manager
body:
Change log (add to squash):
```
fix(node-manager): clearly distinguish between connected and disconnected peers
fix(node-manager): fix incorrect swarm connectivity diagnostic
feat(node-manager): add ability to configure node connectivity timeout
feat(node-manager): highlight under which address a peer is connected to
fix(node-manager): don't disconnect during node swarm-layer startup
```

title: event dump and restore
body:
- add ax events dump
- add NodeId & friends to dump
- store lamport and streams in per-topic DB
- event restore basically works
- switch to raw Banyan usage and polish code
- add sending dumps via cloud

title: truncate sqlite-wal files on node startup
body: fixes #259

title: Check target before source in release process
body:
I deleted a lot of artifacts from our Azure Blob Store account intending to keep only those artifacts we released. Unfortunately, I used the versions file in Actyx/Cosmos instead of Actyx/Actyx and as such screwed all this up. This is the simplest fix of the issue.

Note that there was no logical reason to check the source first since we don't check source against target or anything as such.

title: Document files API
body:
Add reference documentation for the `Files API`.
References https://github.com/actyx-contrib/files-api-uploader, which is the example @wngr added to `rust/actyx/api/examples` and is very useful as a starter when publishing apps to Actyx via the file API.

title: Mention port change in migration docs
body: This came up as a support case at codecentric. While it's in the network requirements docs, they ran into it as it wasn't mentioned explicitly in the v1  migration docs.

title: Work around V1 CORS blockade
body: Fixes #248 (hopefully?)

title: rust/release: only build one global thread pool ..
rust/release: limit parallelism to 6
body:
The CI servers have 64 cores, thus the default rayon thread pools
contains 64 threads. This is apparently too much for the poor azure API.

released in https://github.com/Actyx/ipfs-sqlite-block-store/pull/45

title: Update ipfs-embed
body:
As the gc task wasn't prematurely killed anymore (#228), the task now
blocked the tokio runtime from shutting down.

~Waiting for https://github.com/ipfs-rust/ipfs-embed/pull/105~

title: Pond automatic reconnect Fish (opaque)
body: Update SDK and do a small change in order to get Fish that just continue running through disconnects, without the user noticing.

title: TS SDK Automatic Reconnect
body:
- Add option `automaticReconnect` that will try to re-establish WS connection after it encounters an error
- Add `onError` callbacks to all streaming operations
- Connection errors propagate to the user, require manual restart of ongoing operations
- _The Pond_ has a special mechanism for restarting Fish under the hood (already implemented) meaning Fish continue running _without_ propagating the hiccup

**Integration tests pending**

Manual test: `npx ts-node src/internal_common/conn_test.ts`  inside `js/sdk` folder

title: Fix node-manager-build and upgrade to Rust 1.55.0
Change the defaults for the gc interval, and make things configurable
Document getting logs from Android device
body: Describes how to get logs from Android devices and how to set the log level.

title: Fix problem with putting SDK docs in browser, + onConnectionLost not being called
body: I cannot merge https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/pull/214 , because the SDK that is on npmjs (to be used by the Pond) breaks converting the Pond docs to a website, because the docs have sth. that looks like an HTML tag.

title: Fix WS dying after single wrong chunked request
body:
Fixes https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/11

Turns out I have no clue what a `TeardownLogic` really is and I would  be much better off to use the normal subscription mechanism :)
(The effect was that rxjs completely died after a chunked request had produced an error)

title: util/build.rs: Find parent .git dir dynamically to support other directory layouts.
body:
This broke artifact caching for me using git worktrees, as my directory
layout was different from the expected one.

title: Fix CI validation of TS SDK
C# Implement remaining EventFns
body: Fixes https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/70

title: Add queryAqlChunked
body: Motivation: https://community.actyx.com/t/get-the-last-event-matching-something-before-a-given-offset/177

title: Revert open source change in JS libs for now
body: Remove indicators of full open source for the time being, so that we can continue releasing these packages while the open source plan is still being finalized.

title: rm github link and fix quickstart links
Disable flaky "health" test (part of netsim suite) in Makefile, until it gets fixed
body: Cf. https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/160

title: C# Typed Querying
body: Use C# Tags system to provide queries where the payload is already typed (deserialized into user-defined type).

title: Update libp2p based dependency to libp2p latest master …
body:
… incl https://github.com/libp2p/rust-libp2p/pull/2066

additionally fork all git dependencies into the Actyx org

title: rust/: Add `rust-toolchain.toml` file
body:
This serves as a directory override for all sub directories, instructing
`rustup` to use the specified toolchain.
The toolchain will also be automagically downloaded if not present.

I think this will save some headaches down the road.

title: Get event response  extract accessable
body:
To Be discussed:

In my opinion, the `with_id()` is very useful. 

In my current project, it would be super handy, so I made my own impl, but here would be a better place.

In addition, the `#[cfg(test)]` flag was probably not on purpose here, right?

I have read the CLA Document and I hereby sign the CLA

title: Mention tag:id convention in AQL documentation
body:
When tagging with Pond's `Tag.withId`, it is transparent for the user that this results in `tag` and `tag:id`.
Querying through AQL, he might not be aware of that.

This came up in the Insiders forum: https://community.actyx.com/t/filter-for-tags-with-id/175

This PR adds an info box about that in the query how-to and mentions it briefly in the reference docs.

title: Files API
body: Mostly according to https://www.notion.so/actyx/RFC-2-Files-API-378862e1f8474079a3e21277364328f9

title: Add feedback form to NPS score
body: This adds a form input after submitting the NPS score where users can enter additional feedback.

title: docker/actyx: copy NOTICE file into build
add new validation targets to azure pipelines
Add Pond.currentState
body:
- If the Fish exists, immediately resolves to last known value (because 1 value is always buffered by the subject)
- If the Fish doesn’t exist, will be woken up
- If the Fish already stopped due to an error, you get the error that was thrown by the Fish

Fixes https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/39

title: Pond: Add "publish" function that supersedes "emit"
body: See https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/46

title: TS SDK: `emit` is superseded by `publish` which always returns a Promise
body: Fixes https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/46

title: docker/images/actyx: Add CARGO_BUILD_ARGS
body:
.. fixes
```
Aug 18 00:56:31.379  INFO MIGRATION: Migrating data from an earlier version (1 to 2) ..
Aug 18 00:56:31.411 ERROR MIGRATION: Error during migration: Migrating settings: migration from ActyxOS v1 not built in, please use official binaries
```
https://dev.azure.com/ax-ci/Cosmos/_build/results?buildId=22263&view=logs&j=8e93afe7-f886-5851-7f60-faf34fee94f3&t=b5e02114-cd6e-56dd-f5c0-ab3b3ac2fc65&l=2772

title: clarify license NOTICE and add attribution
body:
feat(node-manager): support PascalCase and camelCase properties in AQL
feat(cli): support PascalCase and camelCase properties in AQL

title: fix image links in migration guide
Fix Pond Hello World example
body:
- `noEvents` is no longer available
- `allEvents` will almost always find events and not print `Hello World!`
- so we use a dummy tag for the time being

Cf. https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/16 and the issues spun off from it.

title: Doc improvements: `toReplicate`, snapshots
body:
- Try giving a better explanation of `toReplicate` that hopefully does not tempt anybody to use this for trying to manage sync / consensus
- Remove some mentions of local snapshots that have been removed with V2
- New data for event issuance latency scaling w/ number of nodes

title: Typed Tags for the C# SDK
body:
So far there is no integration with the rest of the SDK, except for the ability to call `Publish(tags.Apply(event))`.
Will add more in subsequent PRs.

Fixes https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/71

title: fix migration issue
body:
The issue was reported by CTA: taking a non-Docker Windows directory didn’t work: first the `apps` directory (with a deployed app) was in the way, then the topic contained slashes and was not properly translated into a DB filename.

This also fixes compilation on Apple Silicon, which is flaky for the rust-crypto crate (on some computers it builds x86_64 object files, since the used `gcc` crate is too old to set the right arch flags).

- hide migration behind feature flag
- fix some migration issues

title: Port of dotnet test fixes
body:
Fixes https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/issues/26

Port of @2beaucoup ’s changes which make the integration tests finish execution locally.

Sorry about not preserving the actual commit, but I am rather afraid of doing any git magic. Also note that there had been conflicting commits to this repo, so there would be merge conflicts (I already sorted them out in this PR), making everything even more complex.

title: actyx_sdk: enable `rand` dependency when using the `client` feature
body:
came up by the docs build failure:
```
[INFO] [stderr]  Documenting actyx_sdk v0.2.0 (/opt/rustwide/workdir)
[INFO] [stderr] error[E0432]: unresolved import `rand`
[INFO] [stderr]   --> src/http_client.rs:40:5
[INFO] [stderr]    |
[INFO] [stderr] 40 | use rand::Rng;
[INFO] [stderr]    |     ^^^^ use of undeclared crate or module `rand`
[INFO] [stderr]
[INFO] [stderr] error: Compilation failed, aborting rustdoc
[INFO] [stderr]
[INFO] [stderr] For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0432`.
[INFO] [stderr] error: could not document `actyx_sdk`
```
see https://docs.rs/crate/actyx_sdk/0.2.0/builds/421638


* already published
* ref https://github.com/Actyx/Actyx/pull/66
